overview:
Since joining NeoSystems in 2003, Rob Wilson has overseen the firm’s business development operations and led successful efforts to implement several technological solutions and service offerings. His management brings high quality accounting services to clients, while typically reducing their costs.

Rob’s background with developing and implementing new technology helps companies offer superior service to clients. Before joining NeoSystems, he spent four years at America Online as a Senior Technical Manager in Systems and Network Operations. He was a consultant on Netscape’s Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) government contract – a critical program for providing network security.

Rob worked at AT&T for 15 years in important positions. He was capacity planner for FTS2000, a long distance telecommunications service for the federal government and managed computing infrastructure for AT&T’s Business Customer care program.

Rob holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science from the University of Central Florida and is an Executive MBA candidate at the University of Maryland
